title.narrative: OUTP 3.3: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) POLICY, COORD & MGT

description.narrative: Output 3.3: Strengthened national capacity to legislate, coordinate, plan and monitor scaling-up of rights- and gender-sensitive interventions to promote safe drinking water, adequate sanitation and good hygiene practices., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By 2020, Zimbabweans have increased and equitable use of safe drinking water, sanitation and improved hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.3: Strengthened national capacity to legislate, coordinate, plan and monitor scaling-up of rights- and gender-sensitiveinterventions to promote safe drinking water, adequate sanitation and good hygiene practices.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s support to 10Provincial and 51 DistrictWater and Sanitation Sub Committees led to improved sector coordination at all levels especially around COVID-19 and WASH in emergencies, resulting in 88% from 72% baseline in 2017 of the NAC substructures becoming functional andenhanced the prioritization of the WASH interventions. Technical assistance, despite COVID-19 restrictions, resulted inRural WASH Information Management System (RWIMS) being operational in 51 out of the 60 rural districts (85% of target) to improve information management. Advocacy for the approval of the National Sanitation and Hygiene Policy continued and will be sustained in 2022. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:11/01/2022
